result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy E. Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roy E. Spencer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roy E. Spencer was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Roy E. Spencer was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

letter for half-price interlock

Defendant Roy E. Spencer in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was put on the calendar by Mr. Spencer's request.  Court questions the defendant regarding the reduction of jail time request.  Defendant would like to proceed without an Attorney.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Mr. Spencer states his motion to work off time in the jail.  Defendant states that if the court grants his motion; he would have about 20 days worked off already. 
Atty Hendee responds to the motion request.

BY THE COURT:  Court denies the request to work off time.
Treatment Court Hearing at 08-20-2015 01:00 pm
Hearing at 08-06-2015 01:30 pm
Drug court at 08-06-2015 01:00 pm
letter from defendant
Drug court at 07-23-2015 01:00 pm
Drug court at 07-02-2015 01:00 pm
Review hearing at 06-18-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Roy E. Spencer in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. gave apeparances. Parties have Joint recommendation.
Plea to count 1 & 3. Dismiss Count 2. Defendant has been accepted into Treatment Court Program. 
Count 1 recommended sentence withheld with 36 mo probation with conditions: 12 mo. Jail - 6 months stayed for use in Treatment Court. $1494.00 fine & costs; Provide DNA sample & pay $250 surcharge; 24 mo revocation of D.L. and IID; AODA assessment and treatment; any other counseling per agent; participate and graduate from Treatment Court .
Count 3: 30 days jail -stayed to be used in Treatment Court; $243.00 costs. 
 Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3. Count 2 to be dismissed.
Count 1: Sentence withheld-36 months probation with conditions: 12 months in Marquette County Jail with huber. 6 months stayed for use in treatment court; $1494.00 fine & cost; Provide DNA sample & pay $250.00 surcharge; 24 month revocation of D.L. & IID required; AODA assessment and any follow up treatment; any counseling recommended by agent; Participate and graduate from Treatment Court Program.

Count 3: 30 days Marquette County Jail -Stayed-to be used for Treatment Court; $243.00 costs
TREATMETN COURT AGREEMENT
Associated with Charge #1
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-04-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Roy E. Spencer in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he met with the treatment court coordinator with the defendant however, the defendant has not been able to get with MCDS.  The defendant has paid $150 for the assessment but he is on a wait list.  Atty Gumz states that there is an agreement but asks for this to be adjourned to allow time for the defendant to get with MCDS for treatment court program.
Atty Bonnett has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-23-2015 11:15 am
letter from DOC requesting clarification of sentence
AMENDING BOND TO SIGNATURE
CASH BOND AMENDED TO $250 SIGNATURE WITH SAME CONDITIONS
Jury trial on April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roy E. Spencer in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant Roy E. Spencer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there was discussion on possible treatment court at the last hearing; Atty Gumz has been in contact with Ms. Runge.  Atty Gumz agrees and defendant will be going to Chippewa Vally shortly after November 28th.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea and asks for a trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.
bond continued.
Not Guilty plea was already taken.
*Court will allow the defendant to not be present at the final pre-trial.  Jury trial scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on November 13, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Roy E. Spencer in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant Roy E. Spencer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing and requests an Arraignment date.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and waives his right to a Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.
  Return date scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Roy E. Spencer in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant Roy E. Spencer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Set for Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Initial appearance on August 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to PBT upon request by law enforcement.

Defendant Roy E. Spencer by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests Court find probable cause based on the criminal complaint.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.  
Atty Hendee requests $250 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant requests signature bond.  Is working in the area.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $250.00 cash bond with conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
